Chester Holtz

About


I am a junior at The University of Rochester studying computer science and mathematics. I love to make things that are useful and interesting to people and I am not afraid of learning new concepts or trying new ideas.

I am currently a research assistant under Professor Jiebo Luo with the VIStA (Visual Intelligence & Social Multimedia Analytics) Research Group.

Email, Linkedin, GitHub

Microlispjs

A lisp interpreter coded in 200 lines of javascript. The interpreter supports function invocation, lambdas, lets, ifs, numbers, strings, a few js library functions, and lists. This project was inspired by the lisp implementations of John McCarthy, Peter Norvig, and Marry Cook.

Lisp GC

Preformed analysis and wrote a paper on three classic garbage collection algorithms. Implemented parser, evaluator, REPL etc. and 3 garbage collectors - Cheney's algorithm, Mark-Sweep with Tri-color marking, and Knuthâ€™s classical Lisp 2 algorithm in C++.

 

Evis

(WIP) mapping chaotic events (i.e. violence against civillians, natural disasters, etc.) going on in the world based on social media, news, and other sources.

PredPrey

Visualization of swarming systems based on the movements of a predatory creature. Swarm interactions based on model developed with differential equations. Implemented in processing with the processing.js library.

 

Image Decomposition

Decomposed an image into component polygons. An image is a matrix of pixel data - I decompose a complex image matrix into multiple component "simple-matricies" representing polygons. Implimented a basic genetic algorithm with simulated annealing to avoid the local minimum problem.

Kumquat

Job and hobby scheduling web application with elements of a social network. Built in Python with the Flask web framework. Utilized trending technologies such as AJAX and SQL relational databases to build the social network. The code is on github.

 

Distributed Computation

Experimented with distributed computation on networked cluster of 4 raspberry pis. Implimented merge sort and matrix arithmetic algorithms and measured differences in computation efficiency (E/s).

Global Chat

Used the meteor.js framework to develop a global chat application. Instead of logging in, users are defined by their IP address and geolocation. Attempts where made to recreate an environment similar to that experienced by ham radio operators.

 

Unfinished Projects

Projects in various stages of development:
Reddit News: Chrome extension for viewing top reddit posts.
rand_dist_lib: library for random variate generation
Annotated physics: Short, annotated simulations of physical processes.

Select University Projects

Projects done for my classes at the U of R:
Othello AI: Efficient ai in C for othello.
Malloc: Implimentation of dynamic allocation functions malloc, realloc, free with coalescing in C.
n-queens: Implimented and compared several algorithms to solve the n-queens problem in Scheme.
Gaussian Elimination: Implimented and analyzed algorithms for gaussian elimination in Matlab.
nxm sliding puzzle solver: Implimented an A* nxm sliding puzzle solver with obstacles in python.
